skills.desc: My first programming language was Java which I started learning in a high school software class.
My introduction into the Computer Science field was with Python in some of my first courses in college.
My college major was Informatics, which focused on data science and introduced me to SQL.
This is the year I started my internship with the nonprofit called Serve IT, I was asked to work with tools such as Wordpress, GitHub, and Microsoft Access.
This summer I had internship which entailed updating the PHP of a clients website.
As I progressed through my undergrad courses, I was introduced to more complex languages such as Racket.
I started my cognate in undergrad which focused on Game Design, I used C# to create games in Unity.
I took a web development course in undergrad which focused on JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.
After graduating undergrad, I started work at General Motors where I was introduced and worked on Angular web page development.
